pageContext.description: The socketed pommel is formed of a pon-annular ring with trumpet mouthed termination. It probably from this belongs to the iron age. Certainly the spearheads found associated with it belong to Hallstatt period, or end of Bronze age.
pageContext.other: Width: 35mm; at hilt 24mm,Weight: Hilt only 60,64 gms; total 404.61 gms
pageContext.publications: Evans, p. 288, fig. 351,Arch. Vol. LXXIII, Pl. XLIV, fig. 36, pp. 210-225,Arch. Ael. 4 ser. XII (1935), p. 280, ff, Pl. XXVI, 1.2,Proc. Soc. Ant. Ser. II, Vol. V, p. 429.,Hord, Fer. pl. IX, fig. 3,P.P.S., XIII (1947) p. 175 ff.
pageContext.remarks: Part of hoard, including 3 spearheads (Nos. 91, 92, & 93 of this catalogue) and a bronze sword (No. 89).
